TopicTitle: Does is possible to asteroid hit Kerbin

Articles.Content:
I must admit i never try to play with the ARM stuff aside the training mission, it's to difficult to me.

But i wonder does is possible to destroy Kerbin?

Something like this

Does you can improve de grammerz?

On a more serious note, no. You can level KSC with a Class-A, though.

You can make an Asteroid hit the planet, but it doesn't do much. As mentioned by the grammar nanny, if you hit KSC buildings with one, they'd fall down.

Does you can improve de grammerz?

How's your Polish? Is it perfect?

How's your Polish? Is it perfect?

Mine's pretty good.

Now you mention it. Asteroids had a tendency to "float" down to Kerbin because of the soup-o-sphere. And that was kind of a disappointment really. Because you expect a boulder the size of a few buildings with a combined weight heavier than "yo mama" (Sorry I had to say that . Forgive me) to come down pretty fast! But now with the new aero of 1.0.3 and all, things probably changed for the better. Have to try that out once I have the time

Ps. My Polish is pretty bad though
Post made me smile, OP is from Poland. na zdrowie!

Post made me smile, OP is from Poland. na zdrowie!

DziÃ„â„¢ki/Thanks

I just wonder does we can obliterate Kerbin

Or try to save Kerbin for certain destruction and make Jeb look like this guy:D

How's your Polish?

He's re-tiling my kitchen, doing a good job too.

*badumtish* Try the veal.
No matter how big or fast an asteroid hits Kerbin the planet will go on without noticing.

No matter how big or fast an asteroid hits Kerbin the planet will go on without noticing.

Yup. Would be awesome if they exploded and destroyed everything in 2.5km radius.

EDIT: and I mean mid-air. Just like in Chelyabinsk.

Edited June 25, 2015 by Veeltch

I would love to see "destructible terrain"--not only for the hilarity of meteor craters, but imagine the possibilities for excavating! "Mining" ore could actually mean mining, and we could make dug-out underground colonies.

I would love to see "destructible terrain"--not only for the hilarity of meteor craters, but imagine the possibilities for excavating! "Mining" ore could actually mean mining, and we could make dug-out underground colonies.

The Kraken awaits your sacrifice.
Dropping an asteroid on Kerbin not only does not destroy Kerbin, it does not destroy the asteroid.

Dropping an asteroid on Kerbin not only does not destroy Kerbin, it does not destroy the asteroid.

Too Bad:(
Yup. One of my saves was taken with a class E asteroid on a collision course with kerbin. Though you'll find collisions don't do much. (IRL a rock this size would wipe a city)
